title: NOAA declares GOES-18 operational ahead of schedule
summary: The National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration declared the newest satellite in its geostationary fleet, GOES-18, operational Jan. 4 and designated it GOES West.

title: NASA Names New Agency-Wide Chief Technologist
summary: A.C. Charania is NASA’s new chief technologist, serving as principal advisor to Administrator Bill Nelson on technology policy and programs at the agency’s Headquarters in Washington. He will lead technology innovation.

title: Virgin Orbit to conduct first mission from the UK with Start Me Up
summary: Virgin Orbit will carry out the first satellite launch from the United Kingdom on Monday with the first LauncherOne mission out of Spaceport Cornwall. LauncherOne will be dropped from Virgin’s Cosmic Girl carrier aircraft, with release expected off the coast of Ireland during a 10-minute window that opens at 22:16 UTC.

title: Virgin Orbit says it is ready to make history in the United Kingdom tonight
summary: "The public cannot wait for the UK to come and join that exclusive launch club."

title: Rogue Space hires sustainability expert to advocate for startup-friendly policies
summary: Daniel Porras, a former executive at the Secure World Foundation, has joined Rogue Space, a startup developing small satellites for in-orbit services.

title: China’s Tianwen-1 Mars orbiter and rover appear to be in trouble
summary: The two spacecraft making up China’s first interplanetary mission are both suffering issues, with the rover potentially lost on the surface after winter hibernation.

title: Pair of Chinese launches put classified and commercial satellites into orbit
summary: China conducted its first two launches of 2023 over the weekend, sending three classified payloads into geosynchronous transfer orbit and five commercial satellites into sun-synchronous orbits.

title: Virgin Orbit ready for first U.K. launch
summary: Virgin Orbit is set to perform the first orbital launch from the United Kingdom as soon as Jan. 9, a milestone officials hailed as the start of a new era for the country’s space industry.

title: SpaceX gearing up for Falcon Heavy’s second national security launch
summary: SpaceX is aiming to launch Falcon Heavy’s second national security mission for the U.S. Space Force on Jan. 12 from Kennedy Space Center.

title: Virgin Orbit counting down to first historic satellite launch from British soil
summary: A new chapter in spaceflight history will be made when the first ever satellites to be launched into orbit from Western Europe begin their journey into space inside a rocket slung beneath a converted jumbo jet carrier aircraft that will take off from Cornwall on the southwest peninsular of England.
